BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Antoine Semenyo and Conor Gallagher won't yet be able to play for their new clubs in the Champions League. items.ja: Edwards sees hope for Wolves after 'spirited display'
items.en: Edwards sees hope for Wolves after 'spirited display'
items.text_for_match: Edwards sees hope for Wolves after 'spirited display' Wolverhampton Wanderers manager Rob Edwards says his side showed a "spirited display" against Newcastle United, noting that he sees belief returning to his players after going five matches unbeaten. items.ja: Ruthless Man Utd beat Man City in dream start for Carrick
items.en: Ruthless Man Utd beat Man City in dream start for Carrick
items.text_for_match: Ruthless Man Utd beat Man City in dream start for Carrick Michael Carrick gets off to the perfect start in his first match as interim manager for Manchester United with a two-goal derby win against Manchester City, leaving Pep Guardiola's side winless in their past four matches. Michael Carrick gets off to the perfect start in his first match as interim manager for Manchester United with a two-goal derby win against Manchester City, leaving Pep Guardiola's side winless in their past four matches.

items.ja: 'Arsenal will never forgive themselves if they don't win title now'
items.en: 'Arsenal will never forgive themselves if they don't win title now'
items.text_for_match: 'Arsenal will never forgive themselves if they don't win title now' This is Mikel Arteta and Arsenal's "now or never" moment as Premier League title rivals stumble badly, says chief football writer Phil McNulty. items.ja: Barry secures deserved win for Everton against Villa
items.en: Barry secures deserved win for Everton against Villa
items.text_for_match: Barry secures deserved win for Everton against Villa Everton's Thierno Barry capitalises on a mistake by Aston Villa's Emi Martinez for a 1-0 win to The Toffees, which stops Villa going second in the Premier League. items.text_for_match: Villa did not deliver against 'fantastic' Everton - Emery Aston Villa manager Unai Emery is disappointed that his team were unable to convert any of their chances in their 1-0 defeat by "fantastic" Everton. items.ja: Everton win over Villa 'incredibly satisfying' - Moyes
items.en: Everton win over Villa 'incredibly satisfying' - Moyes

items.ja: Newcastle lacked 'cutting edge' in draw against Wolves - Howe
items.en: Newcastle lacked 'cutting edge' in draw against Wolves - Howe
items.text_for_match: Newcastle lacked 'cutting edge' in draw against Wolves - Howe Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe says his side controlled the game but were unable to find a "moment of magic" to score in their goalless draw against Wolves in the Premier League. items.ja: 'I'll be surprised if he's here next game' - Shearer on Glasner
items.en: 'I'll be surprised if he's here next game' - Shearer on Glasner
items.text_for_match: 'I'll be surprised if he's here next game' - Shearer on Glasner Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer expects Oliver Glasner to leave Crystal Palace in the coming week, after his outburst against the board in the wake of their defeat by Sunderland. items.ja: Arsenal stumble in draw against resilient Forest
items.en: Arsenal stumble in draw against resilient Forest
items.text_for_match: Arsenal stumble in draw against resilient Forest Arsenal missed the chance to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points, with a goalless draw against a determined Nottingham Forest. items.ja: Crystal Palace 'abandoned' by board - Glasner
items.en: Crystal Palace 'abandoned' by board - Glasner
items.text_for_match: Crystal Palace 'abandoned' by board - Glasner Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner is left frustrated after his side's defeat by Sunderland, saying the club's board have "abandoned'" them and he can no longer stay quiet because he wants to "defend his players".
